DOC.brief_summary: Children with developmental coordination disorder (DCD) often have poor postural control and motor skills that affect their activities of daily living and participation in school activities. The aim of this randomized controlled trial is to compare the effects of fitball training versus task-oriented motor training for children with DCD.
DOC.brief_title: Fitball Program Versus Task-oriented Motor Program on Improving Postural Control in Developmental Coordination Disorder
DOC.criteria: diagnosis of DCD according to DSMIV criteria Poor motor skills (Movement Assessment Battery for Children score ＜15 percentile, or any two or more of subtests in BOT II ＜ 1.5 SD) aged between 612 years old have attended treatment for motor problems in the previous 6 months any major comorbid medical / neurological / sensory problems such as moderate to severe mental disability, profound visual or hearing impairment, severe sensory problems, or had any major behavioral problems.
